We will continue exploring the longleaf pine restoration efforts in the sandhills with Jeff Marcus, NC Nature Conservancy, who led our visit in March.

Studying live plants, students will sharpen their observational skills as they learn the techniques of realistic drawing. This program is open to all drawing levels.

Come to the Micro World Investigate Lab and learn how to make a DIY gel electrophoresis unit out of used tip boxes, 9 volt batteries and paperclips. This workshop is targeted at public, private and homeschool educators.
Science Trivia nights at the NC Museum of Natural Sciences feature a mix of questions about science facts, current news, pop culture and scientific discoveries.

In this class you will learn to decipher clues of the hidden (often in plain sight) creatures of your backyard and local parks.

Explore nature at Prairie Ridge with a Museum naturalist
Spend the morning in the Jesse P. Perry Arboretum with Jesse P. Perry. The arboretum features breeding pairs of nearly every tree species native to North Carolina, from the mountains to the sea.

In this class we study the strategies different tree species use to: weather severe winds, pump water to their leaves, and disperse seeds. We will learn the all-important role of the cambium layer in creating the tree’s trunk and the function of xylem and phloem cells.
